inquiry.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a question you ask in order to get information
inquiry.translation[0].definitions[0].no: help the police with their inquiries British English (=to answer questions about a crime)
inquiry.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
We’re getting a lot of inquiries about our new London–Rio service.
inquiry.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the act or process of asking questions in order to get information
inquiry.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: On further inquiry, it emerged that Malcolm had not been involved in the incident.
The local council set up a committee of inquiry to look into policing arrangements.
inquiry.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an official process to find out about something
inquiry.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The Civil Aviation Authority has agreed to hold an inquiry into the accident.
The police have launched a murder inquiry.
Parents have called for an independent inquiry into the accident.
a judicial inquiry into the deaths

The special offer has produced a flood of inquiries from interested customers.

inquiry.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: The government has refused to hold an inquiry into the incident.
